main_definition: A deck is a structured arrangement or collection of items, usually related in some way.

meanings_and_examples.definition: a set of cards used for playing games
meanings_and_examples.example: The players shuffled the standard 52-card deck before starting a game of poker.

meanings_and_examples.definition: the floor or platform where various events take place
meanings_and_examples.example: A wedding reception was held on the outdoor deck, overlooking the lake.

meanings_and_examples.definition: a series of related topics or subjects grouped together
meanings_and_examples.example: The seminar covered a wide deck of topics ranging from economics to environmental issues.

meanings_and_examples.definition: the outer covering or surface of a ship, aircraft, or similar structure
meanings_and_examples.example: Marine biologists conducted research on the deck of the oceanographic vessel.

meanings_and_examples.definition: a collection of equipment or tools used for a particular purpose
meanings_and_examples.example: The construction crew unloaded their deck of power tools and materials from the truck.
